t: Exposed: Amazon's enormous and rapidly growing plastic pollution problem | Oceana
s: July 20, 2023 - Sea turtles and other ocean animals mistake the kind of plastic used by Amazon as food, which can ultimately prove fatal. Oceana surveyed 1,400 Amazon Prime customers in the United States and the United Kingdom and found that 94.8% are concerned about plastic pollution’s impact on the oceans.

t: Amazon’s annual plastic packaging waste could circle the world 800 times, report alleges | Euronews
s: December 15, 2022 - ... Employees work at an Amazon delivery station in Rozenburg on November 30, 2022. - Phil Nijhuis / ANP / AFP ... According to a report by ocean advocacy organisation Oceana, Amazon’s plastic footprint increased by nearly a fifth (18 per cent) between 2020 and 2021.

t: Amazon increased US plastic packaging despite global phase-out, report says | Amazon | The Guardian
s: April 4, 2024 - A package on a conveyor belt at an Amazon fulfillment centre in Poland in 2019. Photograph: Beata Zawrzel/NurPhoto via Getty Images ... The same year, 2022, company replaced plastic sleeves in EU with paper and cardboard, and cut plastic packaging globally by 11.6%

t: Amazon announces its largest reduction in plastic packaging in North America to date
s: June 20, 2024 - Last October, Amazon announced our first U.S. automated fulfillment center in Ohio to eliminate plastic delivery packaging, including the transition from plastic air pillows to paper filler. This work in Ohio allowed us to test and learn and move quickly on transitioning to paper filler for ...

t: Amazon is capable of reducing plastic waste in the US. So why isn't it?
s: In response to growing pressure to address the plastic pollution crisis, Amazon has been cutting down on plastic packaging. Last July, the company said it used 11.6 percent less plastic for all of its shipments globally in 2022, compared to 2021. Much of Amazon’s reductions took place in ...
